docs.snippet: Jets General Manager John Idzik defended the team’s relative inaction in free agency during a conference call with reporters on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Jets General Manager John Idzik defended the team’s relative inaction in free agency during a conference call with reporters on Thursday.
docs.abstract: NFL Roundup; New York Jets general manager John Idzik, under fire in his second year as for his relative inaction so far in free agency despite ample space under the salary cap, insists that he is following a plan that will lead to lasting success; other football news noted.

headline.main: Idzik Says Jets Seek ‘Sustainable Success,’ Not Quick Fixes in Free Agency
headline.print_headline: Idzik Says Jets Seek ‘Sustainable Success,’ Not Quick Fixes in Free Agency

docs.snippet: A military judge found Joshua Tate not guilty on charges of sexual assault, and Mr. Tate resigned from the Naval Academy in exchange for a withdrawal of a lesser charge of lying....
docs.lead_paragraph: A military judge found Joshua Tate not guilty on charges of sexual assault, and Mr. Tate resigned from the Naval Academy in exchange for a withdrawal of a lesser charge of lying.
docs.abstract: Military judge Col Daniel Daugherty finds former United States Naval Academy football player Joshua Tate not guilty on charges of sexual assault; Tate resigns from Naval Academy in exchange for withdrawal of lesser charge of lying; verdict is sharply criticized by lawyers on both sides.

headline.main: Former Naval Academy Football Player Is Acquitted of Sexual Assault
headline.print_headline: Former Naval Academy Football Player Is Acquitted of Sexual Assault
